channel.title: Knowledge Bits - text processing
channel.description: References I wish I'd already found

item.title: Converting Lists to Simple Tables and Back with rs
item.description: If you have a file that’s just a list of items, one item per line, and you want to turn it into a simple table — one delimited just by whitespace without any border characters — how would you do that? Follow up question: If you have a simple table, and you want to convert it into a list of items, one per line, how would you do that? The answer to both questions is: with the rs command, and this article will show you how.
item.dc:creator: John T. Wodder II
